sentence: Mr. SMITH of Washington. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would  have voted NAY on Roll Call No. 83.                             personal explanation

…No. 21,  on Motion to Invoke Cloture on the nomination of David Clay Fowlkes to  be United States District Judge for the Western District of Arkansas.  Had I been present, I would have voted nay.

I was unavailable for rollcall vote No. 22, on Motion to Invoke  Cloture on David Clay Fowlkes to be United States District Judge for  the Western District of…

…was laid on the table.

Stated against:

Mr. GOLDMAN of New York. Mr. Speaker, I was unable to vote today due  to an urgent commitment in my district. Had I been present, I would  have voted NAY on Roll Call No. 70.

Mr. GOMEZ. Mr. Speaker, today, I was not recorded on Roll Call Nos.  303 and 304. Had I been present, I would have voted ``NAY'' on Roll  Call No. 303 and ``NAY'' on Roll Call No. 304.                             PERSONAL EXPLANATION

Ms. TITUS. Mr. Speaker, I was absent from the floor and missed Roll  Call Nos. 270 and 271. Had I been present, I would have voted NAY on  Roll Call No. 270, final passage of HR 4922, and NAY on Roll Call No.  271, final passage of HR 5140.

Mr. MOULTON. Mr. Speaker, I was unable to be present today. Had I  been present, I would have voted NAY on Roll Call No. 113 and NAY on  Roll Call No. 114.                             Personal Explanation
Mr. TONKO. Mr. Speaker, I was participating in an Energy and Commerce  subcommittee hearing. Had I been present, I would have voted NAY on  Roll Call No. 51.

Ms. TITUS. Mr. Speaker, I was absent from the floor and missed Roll  Call Nos. 265 and 266. Had I been present, I would have voted NAY on  Roll Call No. 265, the Republican Motion to Table the Democratic Motion  to Discharge H.J. Res. 117 and YEA on Roll Call No. 266, H.R. 3400.…
Mrs. TRAHAN. Mr. Speaker, I was not present for votes today. Had I  been present, I would have voted NAY on Roll Call No. 160 and NAY on  Roll Call No. 161.
Mr. GOTTHEIMER. Mr. Speaker, I missed the following votes, but had I  been present, I would have voted NAY on Roll Call No. 56, and NAY on  Roll Call No. 57.
Ms. ANSARI. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted NAY  on Roll Call No. 314.                             PERSONAL EXPLANATION
Mr. VINDMAN. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted NAY  on Roll Call No. 62.                             PERSONAL EXPLANATION
Mr. GREEN of Texas. Mr. Speaker, I was unable to attend the vote  series today. Had I been present, I would have voted NAY on Roll Call  No. 265 and YEA on Roll Call No. 266.
Ms. McBRIDE. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted NAY  on Roll Call No. 56.
Mr. BARR. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted NAY on  Roll Call No. 63 and YEA on Roll Call No. 64.
Mr. MOORE of Utah. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have  voted NAY on Roll Call No. 333.

…GOLDMAN of New York. Mr. Speaker, I was unable to vote today  because the vote was closed despite my being present in the well and  attempting to vote. Had I been present, I would have voted NAY on Roll  Call No. 343.
Mr. GROTHMAN. Madam Speaker, in a vital meeting--quick gavel. Had I  been present, I would have voted NAY on Roll Call No. 152.
Mr. NEWHOUSE. Mr. Speaker, due to a previously scheduled medical  procedure, I was unable to vote today. Had I been present, I would have  voted NAY on Roll Call No. 263 and YEA on Roll Call No. 264.

Mr. WOMACK. Mr. Speaker, I was unavoidably absent and unable to vote.  Had I been present, I would have voted NAY on Roll Call No. 345, NAY on  Roll Call No. 346, YEA on Roll Call No. 347, NAY on Roll Call No. 348,  YEA on Roll Call No. 349, NAY on Roll Call No. 350, and YEA…
Mr. COLE. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted NAY on  Roll Call No. 60.
Mr. WOMACK. Mr. Speaker, I was unavoidably absent and unable to vote.  Had I been present, I would have voted NAY on Roll Call No. 36, YEA on  Roll Call No. 37, and YEA on Roll Call No. 38.
Mr. BEGICH. Mr. Speaker, I was unavoidably detained. Had I been  present, I would have voted NAY on Roll Call No. 60.

…Res. 88.                             personal explanation

Ms. WASSERMAN SCHULTZ. Mr. Speaker, I was unable to be physically  present for votes today. Had I been present, I would have voted NAY on  Roll Call No. 113 and NAY on Roll Call No. 114.                             Personal Explanation
Mr. HARIDOPOLOS. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted  NAY on Roll Call No. 75.
Mrs. KIM. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted NAY on  Roll Call No. 75.
Mr. GROTHMAN. I was not notified of the vote. Had I been present, I  would have voted NAY on Roll Call No. 178.

Mrs. BICE. Mr. Speaker, I was unable to attend votes today. Had I  been present, I would have voted NAY on Roll Call No. 333 and YEA on  Roll Call No. 334.                             PERSONAL EXPLANATION
Mr. JORDAN. Mr. Speaker, I was absent from the House during today's  two roll call votes. Had I been present, I would have voted NAY on Roll  Call No. 333 and YEA on Roll Call No. 334.
